trial_identification.studytitle: Prediction of your marathon time from a treadmill test
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Predicting marathon time from a graded treadmill test to exhaustion in marathon runners

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions: Participants perform a treadmill test to exhaustion 2 weeks prior to their marathon. The protocol included a five minute warm up at 4% incline and 4km/ h. After five minutes the treadmill speed was increased to 6km/hr. for three minutes. The following stages increased speed by 1km/h every 3 mins until a speed of 13km/hr. was obtained. From here on the speed was kept constant at 13km/hr. The treadmill gradient was then increased by 2% every three minutes until a maximum gradient of 12% was reached Participants continue exercising to exhaustion and then stop. The time of the treadmill test is correlated to marathon time in 42.2km race.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Marathon time at the completion of 42.2km race which occured two weeks post treadmill test.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Recorded from questionnaire prior to treadmill testing, filled out during consent process and returned at time of treadmill test

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of years participant has been running
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Recorded from questionnaire prior to treadmill testing, filled out during consent process and returned at time of treadmill test

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of Hours participant spends running per week
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Recorded from questionnaire prior to treadmill testing, filled out during consent process and returned at time of treadmill test

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: aged over 18 years, running a marathon (canberra 2013, gold coast 2013 or melbourne 2012).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of lower limb ischemia, lower limb amputation, PVD, NSAID use regularly.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Anglesea Sports Medicine Gate 2, Anglesea Clinic 7-9 Thackeray Street PO Box 228 3204 Hamilton New Zealand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study was conducted to investigate the relationship between graded treadmill test to exhaustion and marathon time two weeks later. The aim was to see if a treadmill test could predict upcoming marathon time to help the athlete with pacing and preparation for their marathon.
ethicsAndSummary.publicnotes: Trial Number 12611000468921 registered with ANZCTR. Randomised Controlled Trial used same participants to investigate relationship between functional recovery and compression socks. The trial is currently unpublished but in process of application for publication.
